definition: large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.chinese: 一時間出現了令人尷尬的冷場。

sentences.english: His remark not only broke the ice , but aroused everyone's interest.
sentences.chinese: 他的發言不僅大破了冷場，而且引起了大家的興趣。

sentences.english: He paused and let the silenceaccumulate for a while.
sentences.chinese: 他停頓了一下，讓冷場持續了好一會兒。

sentences.english: Here are the 10 steps for asking questions in a presentation which will help you avoid being left hanging.
sentences.chinese: 以下是避免你的提問遇到冷場的10個步驟。

sentences.english: The President broke the ice by asking me whether I liked New York.
sentences.chinese: 總統問我是否喜歡紐約而打破了冷場的局面。

sentences.english: E. g. He told us an interesting story to break the ice .
sentences.chinese: 他對我們說了一個有趣的故事來打破冷場。

definition: to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
